title: Part A
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for identifying x = –2

1 point is earned for answer with reason

f'(x) = 0 at x = –2, x = 1, and x = 4.

f'(x) changes from positive to negative at x = –2.

Therefore, f has a relative maximum at x = –2.
descriptions:
The student response earns none of the following points:

1 point is earned for identifying x = –2

1 point is earned for answer with reason

f'(x) = 0 at x = –2, x = 1, and x = 4.

f'(x) changes from positive to negative at x = –2.

Therefore, f has a relative maximum at x = –2.

The student response earns one of the following points:

f'(x) changes from positive to negative at x = –2.

Therefore, f has a relative maximum at x = –2.

The student response earns all of the following points:

f'(x) = 0 at x = –2, x = 1, and x = 4.

f'(x) changes from positive to negative at x = –2.

Therefore, f has a relative maximum at x = –2.

title: Part B
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the intervals

1 point is earned for the reason

The graph of f is concave down and decreasing on the intervals –2 < x < –1 and 1 < x < 3 because f' is decreasing and negative on these intervals.

title: Part C
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for identifying x = –1,1, and 3

1 point is earned for the reason

The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = –1 and x = 3 because f' changes from decreasing to increasing at these points. The graph of f has a point of inflection at x = 1 because f' changes from increasing to decreasing at this point.

title: Part D
stimulusHtml:
1 point is earned for the integrand

1 point is earned for expressing f(x)

1 point is earned for f(4) and f(–2)

f(x)=3+ ∫ 1 x f ′ (t)dt f(4)=3+ ∫ 1 4 f ′ (t)dt =3+(−12)=−9 f(−2)=3+ ∫ 1 −2 f ′ (t)dt =3− ∫ −2 1 f ′ (t)dt            =3−(−9)=12 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@8A6A@
